III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
1

and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/27/23, Staff bent Youth's right wrist back along with his arm
by his elbow and pushed him to the ground. There were no visible
bruise or injuries. During restraints, Staff attempts to hurt Youth.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on September 27,
2023. Complainant had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 2, 2023. Youth A said on September 27, 2023, he was
outside the school with his peers and Supervisor. Youth A said he
got into a verbal argument with a peer and Supervisor grabbed his
hand and bent it inward so his fingers were close to his wrist and
said, “you shouldn’t bully other kids because I can do it way
better”. Youth A said Supervisor then began to push him to the
chapel. Youth A said once at the chapel Supervisor pushed him to
the ground and then yelled “get back up”. Youth A said he got up
and Supervisor walked him back to school. Youth A said
Supervisor didn’t say anything to him on the way back to school.
Youth A said Youth B was the only youth present that witnessed
Supervisor bending Youth A’s hand, and that no youth were
present at the Chapel when Supervisor pushed Youth A down.
Youth A said no staff saw Supervisor bend his wrist or push him
down. Youth A said he was not seen by medical after the incident.
Youth A denied telling Eagle Village staff what happened after the
incident. Youth A said Supervisor has restrained him three times
and will always “pull my arms tight and make it hurt”. Youth A
described the restraint and showed the position he was referring
to, which is the benevolent restraint hold that Aegis teaches staff
to utilize.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 2, 2023. Youth B said she was walking to school and
saw Supervisor holding Youth A in a “benevolent hold”,
demonstrating the position which had one arm behind her head
with the hand going down to the middle of the back and the other
arm behind her waist with her arm going up to the middle of her
back. Youth B said she walked into school and a few minutes later
saw Youth A in the school and he was upset so she asked him
why he was in a hold, and he told her “for no reason at all”. Youth
B said that upset her, so she went and found Supervisor and
asked him why he had Youth A in a hold and was told Youth A
2

had a fork he was trying to bring into the school to kill people with.
Youth B said the hold she witnessed looked “normal” and she
denied seeing Supervisor hurting Youth A or being rough while
holding him. Youth B denied Youth A ever disclosing being
harmed or hurt during the restraint.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 12, 2023. Youth C said Supervisor has restrained him
and will hold him “tight”, stating “that’s what he is supposed to do”,
and clarified it is not done in a rough or hurtful manner. Youth C
did not witness the incident on September 27, 2023.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 12, 2023. Youth D said he has seen Supervisor complete
restraints and he has never had any concerns with how they are
completed. Youth D said he has never seen Supervisor hurt youth
in restraints. Youth D did not witness the incident on September
27, 2023.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on October
12, 2023. Staff 1 said he was walking back to the chapel with
Supervisor and all youth on September 27, 2023. Staff 1 said
Youth A was arguing with another youth on the way from chapel to
the school. Staff 1 said once at the school Youth A continued to
escalate so he took all of the other youth into the school while
Supervisor stayed outside to work with Youth A. Staff 1 said
throughout that incident, he never heard Supervisor speaking
inappropriately towards Youth A. Staff 1 said he did not witness
Supervisor engage physically with Youth A in any way during that
incident.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 2, 2023. Supervisor said he and another staff were
walking Putnam youth from chapel to the school when Youth A got
into a verbal argument with another youth. Supervisor said the
argument escalated and Youth A began to threaten harm to the
other youth. Supervisor said he directed Staff 1 to take all the
other youth into school while he talked with Youth A. Supervisor
said he was talking with Youth A about his choices and
encouraging him not to make a scene in front of the school as this
is something he has been working on. Supervisor said as the
other youth from the other houses started to walk closer to them to
go into the school, Youth A became increasingly upset. Supervisor
said Youth A then began to threaten to harm himself and grabbed
a stick that was sharp on one end and placed it towards his
stomach. Supervisor said he attempted to grab the stick by taking
3

Youth A’s hand with one hand and removing the stick with his
other hand. Supervisor said Youth A dropped his weight and was
sitting with him still attempting to get the stick. Supervisor said it
was wet and slippery on the hill they were on and they started to
slide down the hill with him holding Youth A’s arm and stick and
Youth A refusing to let go of the stick and attempting to push it into
his stomach. Supervisor said he was able to talk Youth A into
standing up and continued to hold the arm and stick. Supervisor
said once Youth A was standing Supervisor began to lose grip
and move Youth A’s arm upward and he dropped the stick.
Supervisor said after Youth A dropped the stick, he let go of Youth
A's arm and they walked back to the school and Youth A went to
class. Supervisor said he never walked Youth A back to the
chapel and they were outside the school area and by the gym the
entire time. Supervisor denied pushing Youth A onto the ground.
Supervisor said Youth A never disclosed or complained of being in
any pain while he was attempting to remove the stick from his
hand. Supervisor said after the incident he saw Youth A going into
the nurse’s office for a check due to being in a restraint from the
night prior. This was shortly after the interaction on September 27,
2023. Supervisor said this incident is the first and only time he has
restrained Youth A while he was placed at Putnam. Supervisor
said he did assist in one restraint of Youth A while he was placed
at Leppien. Supervisor denied using any extra force in restraints
with Youth A and stated he follows the Aegis model.
Administrator was interviewed via TEAMS on October 5,
2023. Administrator said she was outside walking the girls to the
school on September 27, 2023. Administrator said she saw
Supervisor reach forward and Youth A drop down to the ground
and then them sliding down the hill. Administrator said she did not
see anything after they slide down the hill as she was with other
youth.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Safety plan dated September 27, 2023, established by
facility in response to the allegations.
• Eagle Village Incident report dated September 27, 2023,
regarding Youth A. The incident report is consistent with
Supervisor’s interview.
• Health Care Visit note dated September 27, 2023, for
Youth A. The note reported a medical follow up from a
restraint. The medical report indicated Youth A stated he
had pain in his right wrist however the exam showed no
swelling or bruising and “range of motion equal bilaterally”.
4

• Supervisor personnel file: Supervisor had one disciplinary
action from March 9, 2021, for engaging in an unwarranted
restraint. Supervisor has participated in Aegis Training as
recent as May 31, 2023, as well as Trust and Trauma
training on October 11, 2023, and Professional
Relationships on August 16, 2023.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Youth restraint. There is no
evidence that Supervisor bent Youth A’s wrist back in a hurtful
manner or pushed him to the ground.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a
youth’s background or appearance to mental state. Yelling,
threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff uses threats when speaking to youth.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on September 27,
2023. Complainant had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 2, 2023. Youth A said Supervisor always tells him that
“he [Supervisor] does not care” and “does not feel bad” for Youth
A. Youth A denied Supervisor making any other statement. Youth
A said Supervisor never says these things around any other staff
or youth. Youth A was not able to remember where he was when
Supervisor made these comments. Youth A denied any other staff
making threats or inappropriate comments to him.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 12, 2023. Youth C said he has been placed at Putnam
house for “many months” and Supervisor has always been the
house supervisor during his placement. Youth C said Supervisor
is “pretty cool” and treats all the youth the same. Youth C said
Supervisor is a “fun and great person to be around”. Youth C said
Supervisor “does his job” and holds youth accountable when
needed. Youth C said Supervisor always speaks to youth
“respectfully, even when we are dysregulated”. Youth C said he
5

has never seen or heard of Supervisor being mean or
disrespectful to any youth.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 12, 2023. Youth D said he has been placed at Putnam
for over a year. Youth D said Supervisor has always been the
house supervisor since he has been placed. Youth D said
Supervisor is “good and hold youth accountable when they need
it”, stating that Supervisor “held me accountable and now I am
doing much better and should be leaving soon”. Youth D said
Supervisor does not say anything disrespectful or inappropriate to
youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on October
12, 2023. Staff 1 said he has worked many shifts with Supervisor
and has not had any concerns about the way in which Supervisor
talks to or treats the youth. Staff 1 said Supervisor is “calm and
quiet” in his approach with the youth. Staff 1 said he has not seen
any concerns with Supervisor’s interactions with Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on October
12, 2023. Staff 2 said she has witnessed Supervisor’s interactions
with Youth A when he is escalated and has never had any
concerns with Supervisor’s language, tone, or approach during
those situations. Staff 2 said she has also seen Supervisor’s
interactions with youth over the years and has not had any
concerns with his interactions with the youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 2, 2023. Supervisor said he has not made any comments
about not caring to Youth A. Supervisor said he has not been
mean or said anything inappropriate to Youth A. Supervisor said
he holds all youth accountable for their actions in his house and
Youth A has been struggling behaviorally recently so has been
talked to many times about his actions, which may be why he
feels Supervisor is being mean to him.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Safety plan dated September 27, 2023, established by
facility in response to the allegations.
• Supervisor personnel file: Supervisor had one disciplinary
action from March 9, 2021, for engaging in an unwarranted
restraint. Supervisor has participated in Aegis Training as
recent as May 31, 2023, as well as Trust and Trauma
training on October 11, 2023, and Professional
Relationships on August 16, 2023.
6

Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Intervention standards and
prohibitions. There is no evidence that Supervisor is mistreating
Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
